title: on me by section 17 of the Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) (as adapted by
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) 

(Amendment) (No. 2) Order 2024. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 10 July 2024.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited immigration act 2004 (visas) (amendment) (no 2) order 2024 (2) order come operation 10 july 2024

title: on me by section 17 of the Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) (as adapted by
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order amends the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014. The Order 
imposes a requirement for nationals of Botswana and South Africa both to 
obtain a visa in order to be granted authorisation to land in the State, as well as 
to obtain a transit visa in order to be granted authorisation to arrive at a port in 
the State for purposes of passing through the port in order to travel to another 
state. 

This Order also allows for an exception to the visa requirement for South 
African nationals who are holders of a diplomatic passport and holders of a 
service passport or public affairs passport who arrive in the State in the 
company of a Minister of the Government where that Minister is on an official 
visit. 

This Order also replaces Schedules 1 and 5 for the sake of sake of accessibility. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [335]
